sentences.text: On 27 November 2024, Syrian opposition groups led by Tahrir al-Sham launched an offensive against pro-government forces in Northwestern Syria. The offensive, the first of its kind by any side in the conflict since Northwestern Syria offensive (December 2019–March 2020)|March 2020 Idlib ceasefire, resulted in the rapid capture of dozens of villages by the opposition forces. During the offensive, rebels reportedly seized 70 sites in the provinces of Aleppo and Idlib and about 10,000 civilians fled the fighting to the Idlib countryside, northwestern Syria.{{bsn|date=December 2024}}

sentences.text: The rebel assault on Aleppo city was spearheaded by Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), but also included various other rebel factions. Among others, there were Syrian National Army (SNA) units The rebels had also sent sleeper cells to infiltrate Aleppo city.<ref name="hassan weiss" />

references.text: <ref name="thermal"/><ref name="hassan weiss">{{cite news |title=The Backstory Behind the Fall of Aleppo|url=https://newlinesmag.com/reportage/the-backstory-behind-the-fall-of-aleppo/ |author1=Hassan Hassan |author2=Michael Weiss |publisher=New Lines Magazine |date=2 December 2024 |access-date=21 December 2024}}</ref>

<ref name="hassan weiss" /> such as the Northern Storm Brigade, Nour al-Din al-Zenki Movement, and Sham Legion.<ref name="new"/> Various Islamist and jihadist militias also took part in the operation, including Ajnad al-Kavkaz,<ref name="TRAC" /> Liwa al-Muhajireen wal-Ansar,<ref name="TRAC" /><ref name="network" /> Mujahidin Ghuroba Division and Katibat al-Tawhid wal-Jihad.<ref name="network" /> The insurgent forces, especially HTS, were well-organized, relatively well-equipped, and highly motivated.<ref name="lister">{{Cite web |last=Lister |first=Charles |date=30 November 2024 |title=Syria's conflict is heating up once more|url=https://www.spectator.co.uk/article/syrias-conflict-is-heating-up-once-more/ |access-date=30 November 2024 |website=Spectator |language=en }}</ref>

sentences.text: In contrast to the rebels, pro-government forces in Aleppo suffered from poor organization, extensive Corruption in Syria|corruption, and poor morale. were killed in the attack, greatly impacting the local leadership.<ref name="hassan weiss" />

references.text: <ref name="lister" /><ref name="collapsed" /> Regular Syrian Army units lacked supplies, were regarded as unreliable, and included many "ghost soldiers" in their ranks. One Syrian Army colonel later argued that the Aleppo-based troops had previously relied on Hezbollah and Iranian officers for operational command, but these had been largely withdrawn from Syria at the time of the opposition offensive. Among the remaining Aleppo-based garrison were Iraqi militias and some Iranian advisers.<ref name="collapsed" /> On 28 November, a meeting of high-ranking officers in Aleppo was successfully attacked by the rebels. Several important commanders, including Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps general Kioumars Pourhashemi,<ref name="hassan weiss" /><ref>{{cite web |title=Iranian Revolutionary Guards officer killed in Syria, - SNN report|url=https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-831147 |website=The Jerusalem Post |publisher=Reuters |access-date=4 December 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 29 November 2024, rebel forces approached the outskirts of Aleppo. They took Khalsa, Al-Rashidin and Khan Tuman, where the army abandoned four T-55 tanks. The Syrian government was overwhelmed by the rebel offensive's speed, and could not organize a coordinated defense of Aleppo.<ref name="ICG" /> The defending units were not provided with a coherent plan, instead being "told to work it out for themselves".<ref name="collapsed" /> Researchers Hassan Hassan and Michael Weiss (journalist)|Michael Weiss argued that the pro-government forces "suffered a complete breakdown in command and control and morale". The main Syrian Army unit on the insurgents' path, Regiment 46, "simply collapsed".<ref name="hassan weiss" /> Some military formations, including the 25th Special Mission Forces Division and Republican Guard (Syria)|Republican Guard, were hastily sent to reinforce the city, and took up position at several strategic locations such as the Citadel of Aleppo. Other pro-government units withdrew southward, such as Harakat Hezbollah al-Nujaba.<ref name="ICG" /> As the insurgents attacked, they initially bypassed heavily fortified strongholds like the Military Academy and Artillery College in favor of a speedy advance deep into Aleppo.<ref name="hassan weiss" />

sentences.text: During the afternoon, rebels entered the Hamdaniyah and New Aleppo neighborhoods in the city, after carrying out a double suicide bombing with two car bombs. In the latter half of the day, opposition forces captured five city districts, Al-Hamdaniya, New Aleppo, 3000 Apartments, Al-Jamiliya, and Salah al-Din districts. Clashes were reported elsewhere in the city, including its center. By midnight, opposition forces had captured parts of Al-Sukariyya, Al-Furqan, Al-Adhamiya, and Saif al-Dawla districts, and claimed to have had taken control of the main square of Aleppo. Around this time, the rebels also approached the Neirab camp where the local loyalist garrison consisting of Liwa al-Quds troops retreated without organizing resistance.

sentences.text: In the early hours of 30 November 2024, rebel forces captured the Citadel of Aleppo and the government headquarters in the city, as well as "more than half" of the city. By morning, rebel forces had seized control of most of Aleppo, facing little resistance and forcing pro-government troops to retreat toward as-Safirah. Government forces and Iranian militias remained in control of a few neighborhoods in northeastern Aleppo. Russian forces abandoned at least three military bases around the city.

sentences.text: The Kurds|Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces occupied Aleppo International Airport and the Shaykh Najjar district, following the withdrawal of pro-government forces. In the evening, rebels took control of Aleppo airport from the SDF without clashes. An airstrike, reportedly carried out by Russian aircraft, killed 16 civilians and injured 20 others in the city. Two other airstrikes on rebel reinforcements on the outskirts of the city left 20 fighters dead.
